frame.name: Commerce_pay
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame involves <fen>Buyer</fen>s paying <fen>Money</fen> for <fen>Goods</fen>. In this frame the <fen>Money</fen> is the direct object, and is mapped to the theme of the transfer.</def-root>

FE.name: Buyer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Buyer</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex><fex name="Byr">Gem</fex> <t>paid</t> fifty dollars for a shirt</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction. <ex>Kim <t>paid</t> fifty dollars <fex name="Gds">for the shirt</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The means by which a commercial transaction occurs. Abby <t>bought</t> the car <fex name="Means">with cash</fex>. Robin <t>paid</t> for the car <fex name="Means">by check</fex>.</def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root>Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction. <ex>Pat <t>paid</t> <fex name="Money">14 dollars</fex> for a movie ticket.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods. <ex>The manager <t>pays</t> the paper boys <fex name="Rate">five dollars an hour</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Seller
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Seller</fen> has the <fen>Goods</fen> and wants the <fen>Money</fen>. <ex><fex name="Slr">The landlord</fex> is <t>paid</t> $700 a month by the tenants for the apartment. </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment>-PP. <ex>Bob <t>pays</t> for peppers <fex name="Unit">by the pound</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The purpose for which an intentional act is performed.</def-root>

FE.name: Reason
FE.definition: <def-root>The Reason for which an event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the paying event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Buyer</fen> that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). <ex>She <fex name="Manner">quietly</fex> <t>paid</t> the bill and left.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.
<ex>Worker 's compensation <t>payments</t> alone <fex name="Circumstances">in cases involving falls</fex> , now average more than $8500 per incident in North America .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition:
<def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.
<ex>A good tenant <t>pays</t> her rent <fex name="Frequency">regularly</fex></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: pay.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: give someone money in exchange for goods.

lexUnit.name: payment.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an amount paid or payable.

lexUnit.name: disburse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pay out (money from a fund).

lexUnit.name: shell_out.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pay a specified amount of money, especially an amount regarded as excessive.
